feed.title: Aimee Schulz
feed.subtitle: NSF Graduate Research Fellow at Cornell University

entry.title: A Seed Dispersal Game - Curriculum for teaching plant domestication and adaptation

link.title: A Seed Dispersal Game - Curriculum for teaching plant domestication and adaptation

entry.content: Alongside another graduate student, we have developed extensive curriculum for teaching plant domestication and adaptation! I will migrate some materials here, but in the meantime, check out our lab website: Maize Genetics Game.
entry.summary: Alongside another graduate student, we have developed extensive curriculum for teaching plant domestication and adaptation! I will migrate some materials here, but in the meantime, check out our lab website: Maize Genetics Game.

entry.title: reelGene presentation at Cornell PBG Seminar

link.title: reelGene presentation at Cornell PBG Seminar

entry.content: As part of the Cornell Plant Breeding Student Seminar Series, I presented my work on reelGene to the department.
entry.summary: As part of the Cornell Plant Breeding Student Seminar Series, I presented my work on reelGene to the department.

entry.title: Maize competition dynamics presentation at Cornell PBG Seminar

link.title: Maize competition dynamics presentation at Cornell PBG Seminar

entry.content: As part of the Cornell Plant Breeding Student Seminar Series, I presented my work on maize intraspecific competition to the department.

entry.title: Minnesota Four for Four Interview
entry.content: As a Minnesota 4-H alumni, I was interviewed for their Four for Four video series.
